name: Learningos
tagline: My Notes and Questions from a Book I am auditing
body:
---
What is  extracted from a Boot-Disk?
Where is the boot-disk? 
>>address of the interrupt handler we're looking for: IDTR * 4
http://wiki.osdev.org/Interrupt_Vector_Table#Structure
??Difference between interrupt descriptor table and interrupt vector table??
>>An ISR is called directly by the CPU, and the protocol for calling an ISR differs from calling e.g. a C function. Most    importantly, an ISR has to end with the iret opcode, whereas usual C functions end with ret or retf
---
How do ISR help loading the OS into the RAM from the boot-disk?
Real Address mode = 1 MiB memory! 2^20 locations to address!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Who loads the OS into memory? 
From where does the program finds the OS?
BIOS or the boot loader ?
